chapter.title: Device Manager
chapter.para: The Device Manager shows information about the hardware that is currently installed in your system and which can be used by Ubuntu. Linux uses the so called HAL (Hardware Abstraction Layer) to access the hardware. Every application can use the HAL and does not need to know itself exactly how to use that piece of hardware. The goal of the HAL is to make hardware "just work" in a desktop system.

There are very few options in the Device Manager. It is mostly useful for seeing what kind of graphic adaptor or sound card you have installed, without having to open and inspect your computer. The Device Manager is not a place to configure your hardware. Ubuntu probes your system and makes a best effort to determine which hardware you have and how to control it.
